intro: Tarenna velutina, commonly known as the velvet tarenna, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and small, clustered leaves that are covered in a fine, velvety pubescence. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with five petals and a prominent central tube. Tarenna velutina is often found in humid, shaded environments within the rainforest understory.
